titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Faculty-Student records, Annual Reports to the University of the State of New York (State Education Department)
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Faculty-Student records, Annual Reports to the University of the State of New York (State Education Department) FA1331

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-11-14 00:00:45 -0500.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Faculty-Student records, Annual Reports to the University of the State of New York (State Education Department)

physdesc.extent: 2 boxes, 1 letter document box, and 1 half letter document box.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of the reports made to the New York State Department of Education for each academic year. The collection also occassionally contains some associated correspondence between A. Gold (Vice President) and Norman Mercer.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Between 1955-1964 Douglas Whitaker, Vice President, carried administrative responsibilities which included annual reports required by the University of the State of New York. These reports were primarily financial and reflected the condition of the University. The State Department of Education served to collect data for the Higher Education General Information Survey (HEGIS). As the programs of State aid to non-public institutions of higher education developed reports in many more areas were required. Reports had to be made on housing, coursework, laboratories, degrees conferred, subject distribution of faculty and students, financial aid and library facilities. Reports from many offices of the University on their particular area were required. These reports which first went to the Office of the Vice President were assembled in the Office of Faculty and Student Records and reports were forwarded from there
The Rockefeller Institute did not become a degree granting institution until 1954 and the first academic year ended in June 1956 which is the date of the first report.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: This registration permitted an exemption from certain reports. This exemption was disallowed in 1956/1957 because of a misunderstanding that it was necessary to refile each year for the exemption.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reports for 1964 and 1965 are not in the collection.
